attributes.action: take an active, public role in promoting National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 13-19 May 2007
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In England and Wales 29% of mothers do not breastfeed. Yet we know that breast is best for the health of mother and baby.

What we need is an environment where women are comfortable with feeding their baby anywhere and at any time. We need to create an atmosphere of support from friends, family, partners and health professionals. The more vocal this support the stronger the encouragement to new mothers to take up and carry on breastfeeding their infant.

We call on the Prime Minister to take a public role in promoting National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2007, 13 to 19 May, for the good of the nation.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "take an active, public role in promoting National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 13-19 May 2007."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12201.asp

Prime Minister's Office
